alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:58PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 845 PM MST... At 758 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Angell, or 17 miles east of Flagstaff, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Wukoki Pueblo in Wupatki N.M., Angell, Sunset Crater N.M., Locket Meadow CG, Canyon Diablo, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Merriam Crater, Sugarloaf Mountain, Timberline, Painted Desert Vista, Doney Mountain, Hutchinson Acres, Wupatki N.M., Winona, Doney Park, Wupatki National Monument, Leupp, Black Falls, and Grand Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 210 and 227. State Route 99 between mile markers 70 and 71. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 424 and 440. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim
